item.description: Apparently after editing the comment number in the comment_count table to the appropiate comment count. The subsequent additional increment of comments for that post resumes normally. Other posts still has the comment_count frozen.

item.description: The comments moderation are not on by default in my case. The comments_popup_link() and the comments_number() simply do not read any post numbers or even show up in one post though there are comments in the post.

item.title: wordpress-redirect.patch attached to Ticket #1923

item.description: Patch

item.title: Ticket #1923 (When using mod_rewrite to rewrite to https, changing themes fails) created
item.dc:creator: Blejdfist
item.description:
When using a configuration like this and having site url configured as beeing â€‹http://... Changing themes fails with the message "Sorry, you need to enable sending referrers for this feature to work.". 

RewriteMap      lowercase int:tolower
RewriteCond     %{REQUEST_URI}         ^/.*/wp-login.php [OR]
RewriteCond     %{REQUEST_URI}         ^/.*/wp-admin/
ReWriteCond     %{HTTPS}               !^on$
RewriteRule     .                      https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI}

item.title: Ticket #1922 (glob() requires php 4.3) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Description changed

item.title: Ticket #1922 (glob() requires php 4.3) created
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: glob(), used in cache.php, requires php >= 4.3. WP must support php >= 4.1. We need a compat function for glob(). See â€‹http://us2.php.net/manual/en/function.glob.php#54519 for a possibility.

item.title: betterfix.diff attached to Ticket #1921
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: Compacted js doesn't diff well.

item.title: Ticket #1921 (Better fix for TinyMCE/Publish bug) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
The first fix allowed the offending function to return if it didn't get the argument it needed. This is less of a hack. It makes the offending function work rather than skipping it.

Submitted bugs to Mozilla for changing browser behavior and Moxiecode for needing more robust code.

item.title: Ticket #1911 (Auto-deactivate plugin on delete) reopened
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description: This is still a valid ticket, the plugin is never really deactivated, it is just not loaded. Move the plugin file back to its original name and you will see that it is still activated.

item.title: Ticket #1916 ("Use the visual rich editor when writing" is inaccurate) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
the option on Options => Writing "Use the visual rich editor when writing" is worded incorrectly... it doesn't correspond with its function. It sounds like a user preference when it is actually a global on/off switch. If the box is unchecked people can't use WYSIWYG even if their preference is set to use it. I think the following wording is better:

"Allow users to use the visual rich editor when writing"

item.title: Ticket #1819 (extra <a href="http://www.LINK.org" /> links "Posted in") updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Severity changed

Not a major bug (the extra links are invisible), nor is it a problem with WP (it's TinyMCE), so I'm setting severity to minor.

item.title: Ticket #1641 (Sort plugins by name instead of filename) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Keywords changed

I'd say sorting by filename is better. Users aren't interested in what order their plugins are loaded in. If they are, they can just open up their wp-content directory and have a look.

item.title: Ticket #1911 (Auto-deactivate plugin on delete) closed
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
worksforme:

From wp-admin/plugins.php:

"If something goes wrong with a plugin and you canâ€™t use WordPress, delete or rename that file in the wp-content/plugins directory and it will be automatically deactivated."

It already does this!

Tested on revision 3161

Activated plugin, renamed to pluginname.bak checked to see it not in plugins list, renamed back to orginial plugin name and it wasn't activated

item.title: Ticket #1914 (Permalinks for unattached uploads/attachments) closed
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
wontfix:

Attachment permalinks are in the form [parent permalink]/[attachment slug]. There is not an intermediate attachment permalink style. What is an attachment without something to attach to?

It has not been decided what to do with orphaned attachments, although I think we should drop and unlink.

item.title: Ticket #1914 (Permalinks for unattached uploads/attachments) created
item.author: dlhau@â€¦
item.description:
Currently attachement links are in the form: 

http://www.example.com/?attachment_id=1

Would look much neater if these matched the permalinks of regular posts (depending on what it is configured to) eg: 

http://www.example.com/attachement/1/

item.title: Ticket #1913 (Wrong PCRE flag break TinyMCE on lower PHP versions) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #1912 (Postmeta Values may not be literal zeroes) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: The add_meta() function uses a simple if !empty($metavalue) check to determine whether a meta value has been supplied. empty() treats zeroes as false, so a literal zero as a postmeta value fails. The attached patch fixes it. The patch DOES NOT allow a zero for a postmeta key.

item.title: Ticket #1911 (Auto-deactivate plugin on delete) created
item.dc:creator: Ajay
item.description:
I don't know if this has been posted before, if it has please delete this post.

I wanted to suggest that a plugin be auto-deactivated if the file is deleted from the /wp-content/plugins folder.

This helps because if a plugin that is installed causes your site to break, you can just delete the file and the plugin is deactivated. Currently if you do this, and then reupload the plugin file it will again break your site.

I hope this makes sense.

Ajay
